one_reviews_text: so when i try to make a sharp turn it just doesen't work. i will put this a 4 stars but fow now its a 3 star because of the turning. the rest of the game looks great.
review_feedback: Change the flight settings from Arcade to Simulation.

review_title: Please help Reverb G2 Controller Support
one_reviews_text: My family & I loved this game when we had the Rift S, but ever since using the HP Reverb G2 with Revive, the game doesn't recognize my HP Reverb G2 controllers. Please help!

If you are looking for a realistic flight simulator this is not for you, but do not let the cartoonish appearance fool you. I could spend hours playing this game. There is plenty to unlock and it is really a blast. You really feel like you are flying. I wish they had more aircraft and will probably make you sick the first few times playing it, it is the only VR game that has done so.

Always liked flying games, and this takes it to the next level.  World is not "realistic" looking; looks like a computer game from the 2000's, but the flight controls are real and the missions are entertaining.  It does take a while to progress, however.  Been playing a few hours and still haven't gotten past the first aircraft.  Still, for the money, great VR app.

I gave this two stars. With only a little work it could be four stars. I play it a lot. In the beginning, the nausea factor was extreme. Now, months later, the nausea factor is minimal. I have concluded that the more time you spend in VR, the less the nausea factor, especially if you never try to "push through" the nausea, but STOP when it first starts. Anyway, I am a fixed wing and rotary wing pilot. I owned a helicopter logging operation for years. I also have over 600 hours in ultralights. My first complaint about the game is the scenery. It's too simplistic. Yes, better scenery requires a lot of resources, but most games have better graphics than this and can run well on the Quest. There's no excuse for crappy graphics on the Rift. Much better graphics would gain another star or two. Second complaint is the handling of the aircraft. I've flown every kind of real aircraft imaginable, and also in the ultralight class. I've owned more of them than I can count. I've even owned and flown "2-axis" aircraft, which I hate, and also 3-axis aicraft which used "spoilerons" instead of ailerons. Spoilerons suck. I hate them. But even spoilerons provide a much crisper roll than this thing in Ultrawings. No ultralight handles that sluggishly unless it's actually stalling. Roll control is the worst, but pitch is problematic also. At a cruising speed, any ultralight (except weight shift) will provide a crisp response. Nothing is as mushy as the craft in this game. Interestingly, the yaw response is pretty-much dead-on what it should be. In any case, I do get a lot of enjoyment from this game and would buy any upgraded version. I just hope any upgraded version is SIGNIFICANTLY upgraded. It would be very, very cool to see this include trikes and other weight shift contraptions -- in fact anything that does, or can, or MIGHT fly would be a hoot. I'd pay a lot for a truly comprehensive upgrade. Of all the wild things I've ever flown, ultralights were always, always the most fun.

I have a lazy chair, you know... those that have an electric motor in 'em to move the leg-, and backrest up and down
The problem is that my flightstick is exactly where my physical "joystick" is also, but there is some tolerance, so I can grab the flight stick a bit higher (upto my neck...,) but...to climb higher in a bit steep angle I'd need to be able to either put my flightstick hand inside my upper body, or play sitting on the floor or on one of those plastick chairs that you always have to sit on when you visit a lecture or convention.
Unless you enjoy sitting on the kind of chairs that are not made to sit on for hours on end, I'd advise you not to buy this game

Every model comfortable chair with armrests will position most of your controls somewhere inside the chair, or inside your body
This makes flying any plane neigh impossible

Would it really be so hard to have players setup the positions of all controls where it suits them best, you know... just grab, drag, and drop
It may not be super easy to change the positiond of all cockpit instruments

but I'm certain it won't be so difficult that it would take forever to add this option to the program

I've tried moving my chair backwards a bit, and that did help with descending and to a lesser degree with climbing, as far as the switches are concernd, those still end up inside the chair and inside the body

I cannot imagine me being the only one who's bothtered by this sloppy design and lack of customisation  options

IF this functionality would be added to the cockpit I'd give the game a solid 5 stars
Without it, the game gets a meager 1 star for .... just because I have to give at least a real amount of stars

I just don't want to be forced to play a "flight sim" sitting on some lousy plastic or wooden (fold-up) chair

This game is truly fun. The planes are all fun, with a unique feel all their own. I love that all the controls incorporate the Oculus Touch Controllers. I don’t understand those who want VR flight controls on a game pad.

The mini games are fun, and ramp up in difficulty at a reasonable rate. Free flights allow you to play around in the somewhat limited terrain to your heart’s content.

For the developer: Aside from more islands and planes, could I please get a King Kong style monster climbing the statue on that I can shoot down with the sport plane? That’d be awesome.
I bought this quality title on my Quest and now I see it is cross buy on my Rift S. Congrats to the devs. This game is amazing fun and now I can play on both systems. The price is fair too.

review_title: Love it, but want better controls
one_reviews_text: It's great fun to fly through rings and do spot landings... but the control setup is really rather wonky.  If you have a HOTAS it's not too hard to swap buttons around. But cusomising things that require an analog axis like throttle pitch, roll, and yaw become impossible if you don't have the setup they anticipated.  Great fun, though.

I would love to give this game 5 stars because the controls and flying sensation are brilliant.  However, the later islands get really frustrating due to game crushing bugs that are simply unforgivable.  Most of these concern Balloon Popping with the ultralight; the balloons you pop simply don’t register on the later islands (with the ultralight).  I don’t know whether you are not supposed to have the lazer gun on these levels, but if you are, you don’t, forcing you to pop the balloons with the ultralight or the wings which is very difficult and only not to get them to count!!  On one of the levels you are even placed on the ground, off the runway and with no fuel; unforgivable!!  Later levels also have soul crushingly ridiculous time limits, this is not a bug but simply extremely unfair with the level of control this game offers with default virtual hands, which is cool and I love, but not up to HOTAS standards.  If this game has been fully game tested I will eat my Oculus Rift…

review_title: One of the best VR flying games
one_reviews_text:
Ultrawings is a refreshing change of pace from the myriad of other half-baked flying/simulation games with messy controls or VR that feels like an after thought. This game's immersive control system and simple yet varied challenges work well and feel more rewarding the more you learn as the game goes on and you unlock the available aircraft. You have the option to use control sticks to fly, but with the hands-on realism style of piloting that feels really fleshed out, you won't want to use anything else. The visual style isn't the most realistic but it has charm all the same and makes the world feel friendly as well as helping with potential motion sickness. I found it easy to sit down with this for hours at a time and just glide around and get lost high up in the laid back atmosphere. 
My only qualms are that sometimes the shooting and photo challenges can feel a bit hard to manage while simultaneously controlling the planes, and it would be nice to have one or two more types of aircraft and challenge mechanics to play with. Maybe wingsuits would be a great add-on? But in any case, if you enjoy flying and immersive simulation, you owe it yourself to give this game a shot. You may find you get quite a bit of enjoyment for the price. Well worth it in my opinion.

It's a great game but the glider is pretty much impossible to steer quickly enough to do most of the courses. I've been using the glider for three days now and I have not managed to complete any missions on it. Also when doing the picture missions I have my camera right on the thing and it says it's not in veiw! It's a great game and I do recomend that you should buy it, but prepare to have a very bad time with the glider. Plus just replace the glider with something else, IT SUCKS!

This game is pretty great.  It gives you some convincing flight dynamics without going overboard on detail like a true simulator.  It reminds me a lot of the old PilotWings games on SNES and N64.  I've only been playing a couple hours but I can tell I'm already going to be hooked.  Hasn't gotten me sick yet, but I can imagine that depends a lot on your flying ability.  Someone who has played simulators before or is familiar with piloting dynamics is more likely to keep their plane stable and less motion sickness inducing.

Anyway, definitely worth a try, works great with the touch controllers!

Loved this game right from the start! Tons of content to play through (I've played 4 hours and am only 8% through the game) and even my girlfriend who doesn't play much VR loves it! Feels like you're flying but is still arcadey enough to not punish you for not knowing how to actually fly. Great game!

You fill fond yourself saying Wow ! After every new goal. Sitting for hours on end perfecting the art of flight as you navigate an exciting career mode style of play with plenty of challenges to keep you busy. Buy it. It's so cheap for what you get out of it.
Trouble is I can’t seem to get past the tutorial levels, I can’t find a way to progress to the actual missions . Please can anyone help?!

review_title: Thx for Crossbuy with upcoming Quest!
one_reviews_text: The dev has announced that they will support crossbuy with this title if you purchase on Home, so if you get a Quest in the future you will have rights to the game on there without having to rebuy it. Thanks dev, you earned my purchase!

Bought on sale but sale item was only for Rift platform when everywhere else it supports the Go platform. Thanks for the bait and switch. I'll read all your "offers" much more closely from now on. Oh and Tech Support at Oculus is a joke. Three people "tried" to help and not one offered any true assistance.  Oh and no phone number to call into all email. Very disappointed in Oculus in general!!!

review_title: Made me queasy but great if immune
one_reviews_text: This one would be great for anyone who likes flying and doesn't get motion sick in VR.  I can handle most games but this one made me queasy, so buyer beware.
Each time I start the app, I have to start all over again from the begining.. How can I save my achievments????

The feeling of flying, being free in the sky is amazing. I've only flown Cessnas a couple dozen times but this is more affordable hehe
It's awesome flying over the islands and the seas, fulfilling missions and just having a great time. I had a gear VR and played this and it sold me on an upgrade to Rift.

After some initial issues got ironed out through updates this game is a lot of fun! The controls are intuitive and easy to learn and experiencing flight in VR is a blast. 

I really like the approach that you start off with a slower plane and gradually work yourself up to the faster, more maneuverable stunt plane. That way you gradually build up a stomach for the potentially more motion sickness inducing way of flying. 

I do however find the missions to get the higher tier planes a bit repetitive. And I really, REALLY wish there was a multiplayer aspect to the game. VR experiences that can be shared with friends just adds a whole new level of immersion and really increases the fun factor.

All in all though, a very nice experience and definitely worth its money!

At the devs: sorry for neglecting to update my initial review for so long. Great work with the updates and the overall game guys!

review_title: Fantastic, relaxing, hectic, all at once
one_reviews_text:
This game at first seems really ordinary, until you really get into it, its just a fantastic smooth and well thought out game. The flight mechanics are really fun and when I started flying my glider with my opposite hand and reaching out of its window to shoot some balloons, I realized this game was actually genius! That was some of the most fun Ive had in VR. I'm not finished with it, but I unlocked the second plane and its already starting to get more interesting.

If you were a big fan of games like Pilot Wings (nintendo) or Sky Odyssey(ps2) you gotta try this, its really fun.

EDIT: Although I have a hotas (for games like Elite and Overload), I opted to use the oculus touch controllers and I think they add a ton to this experience in my opinion, there's something really fun about getting immersed into those controllers being your hands, and the vibration feature actually helps too.

review_title: Weird mix of flight realism/ kids gam
one_reviews_text:
The good:  Pretty good flight models, bug free.  Planes are fairly realistic.
The Bad:  Some cringe worthy gameplay of flying way to close to things, timed missions, which no one likes, takes a long time to get a real plane,  the gliders guns will make you deaf they are about 20 times louder than anything else.  Runways too short, and with obstacles near them.  More game than sim.  Graphics very simple.

Offers a very entertaining experience with surprisingly precise controls. Encountered some crashes and bugs, but hopefully they get ironed out (some already did). 

Graphics are nice but could use some more details like birds in the air, fish in the sea and maybe some other planes flying around in freeflight. Also i expect an expansion with with a fourth island/plane. But still a lot to love here, so i already give it 5 stars. Best flightsim yet on the rift in my opinion!

UPDATE: Just wanted to mention that now there are birds, planes and other things that make the world feel more alive. Also forth island and plane. All updates recived for free. Great work devs!

Only downside for me is how the game handles language support. I prefer playing in english but since it got german language support all text are in german with no option to change that while voiceovers stay english. Please add language settings (like every game here on oculus should but often doesnt) and i will give you 6 stars!!

I love this game. it is addicting flying around. however I wish there was more airplanes. 4 is ok but it takes days doing the same repetitive flying around to discover them. add like military combat mode or something like dog-fights would be so amazing. multiplayer mode would be great too so you can sell things to friends etc.

I have played around 3 - 4 hours of this game and I have got to say flying over the beautiful seenary is one of the most amazing aspects of the game. Although it is amazing, for me, it is becoming stale and uninteresting as there is alot of time put in and not much return.

Flying the ultralight for the first time felt kinda meh. I changed the flight controls to sim mode and now I feel like im in control. I love controlling the aircraft with the touch controllers. I'm usally sitting forward hand on the stick for fine control in missions. In free flight i'll sit back and use the right analong stick for the small adjustments while cruising around. I did manage to do a loop in the ultralight, was hoping for an achievement. Although pulling up, putting it into a stall and flipping backwards may not count.

A few things that bug me is the lack of backlighting on the airspeed. When im facing the sun that thing may as well not be there. Had no idea how to progress past the first few missions until I was just flying around and landed at another runway. Landing missions with the ultralight is more like giant lawndarts then skilled landing.

Uncontrollable game, whether with oculus touch, joystick thrustmaster or Hotas Warthog. Can not manage it properly l'm terribly disappointed with this game. I was hoping that every update would fix problem, but alas no. Game not in focus. I regret my purchase.
review_feedback: Please email us at support@bitplanetgames.com.  We want to know what problems you are having.

review_title: Great apart from two annoyings things
one_reviews_text:
One. The game often starts off thinking I am using a HOTAS when I am using touch controllers and I don't even have a HOTAS controller plugged in.

Also the instruments are often way to dark to read inside the plane/glider, why would they ever get in so much shadow, there should be more than enough bounce light to make them easily visible even with the sun in front of you.

These two problems do not detracts from this being one of my most played VR titles, its such fun to play and a great pick and play game for when you only have a short amount of spare time.

Don't be fooled by Ultrawings cartoonesque GFX , this game is quite superb in terms of believeable flight physics especially on simulation mode, The gameplay is very reminiscent of Microsoft Flight, flying through hoops and landing in new areas which you can purchase when you have completed challenges and earned enough in-game currency.. you can also buy new aircraft / offices at unlocked locations throughout the gameworld, each area presents a new set of challenges which become more difficult. The progression is relatively challenging even on arcade mode.    

The GFX are colourful, crisp and cheerful , performance is excellent on my 980, the sound effects are also realistic whilst in flight, the music score suits the game perfectly  , I'm looking forward to playing more of this game over the coming weeks , I highly recommend this game to anyone, a perfect game for all the family.

For less than £20 it's really difficult to find fault with Ultrawings. You could argue that the gameplay is somewhat simplistic, which it is, but then it's not pitching itself as a hard core flight sim. Think PilotWings in VR. If you enjoy fun, challenging gameplay coupled with superb touch control implementation, great graphics with a really nice art style and great sound then Ultrawings hits the mark. Highly recommended.
the games is awesome but I am missing more vehicles for example a jet

what /how is the HOTAS support. will any joystick work.
I can not reliably adjust the throttle with the hands. is there another control?
Great Game...
review_feedback: We currently support HOTAS4, HOTASX, Warthog, T16000M, X52, and X56.

review_title: Fun & challenging, but could be improved
one_reviews_text:
I've had this game for a while, and I still play regularly!
There's a nice variety of mission types, the flight-physics are relatively realistic, and challenging. And the simpler-turning option is good for noobs and giving VR demos.
Biggest bug still seems to be that they left physics enabled on the in-game laptop.. so it tends to glitch out..
Also, I'd like to see a more inland mountain-range-style map someday. And I kinda wish we had access to the weapons or other special features used in missions, more in the freeflight mode, so we could shoot at randomly generated baloon targets or whatever lol.
I love the Touch control method, and I think they've improved it over several updates.
Random side note: Anyone think the male instructor voice sounds a bit like Wil Wheaton?
I hope the devs can add more to this over time. If not, I hope Ultrawings 2 gets multiplayer, cause that would be amazing. I'd love dogfighting in this game!
Conclusion: Worth it! Certainly get this game if you like flight sims! Or if you see it on sale someday! ;)
review_feedback: This will be fixed in the next update!

one_reviews_text: It might not be flashy but it hits the spot on what a good VR experience is supposed to be. Highly interactive and very immersive. It even has some really good view options for those who have motion sickness, I personally don't, but it can get a little disorienting. Awesome game!

I've had a Rift for over 6 months and own dozens of games, and this is one of my favourites. I like the idea of flight sims, but the serious ones can be a bit boring to actually play. Ultrawings is great to just pick up and immediately start having fun. 

The physics are probably not as realistic as top flight sims, but they're actually decently realistic in simulation mode (you can stall for example). The graphics are simple, but the aesthetic works and it runs great.

Using Touch controls to flip switches in the cockpit and work the joystick is really immersive. That said, I found myself mostly using the thumbsticks to fly after the first few hours, because it's tiring to hold your arm in the air without having a physical stick to grab on to.

The missions have enough variety to keep me from getting bored, and trying to achieve a gold medal on every mission is a satisfying challenge.

By the way, don't get discouraged if you find the starting plane a bit slow - there are two more unlockable planes that are more exciting to fly.

This one is pretty fun. Has a sense of humor and fun graphic. A few of the controls seems a little off (I'm looking at you fuel switch) but otherwise enjoyable. I would love to see more landmarks early on. Just flying over a cartoon ocean can get a bit snoozy.
This game is so much fun. for Under £10 its one of the best games ive bought. I do hope they add more content however, as after 30+ hours, it could get very samey.

Don't expect a true flight simulator, but if you want a fun objective-based flight game with INCREDIBLE controls and excellent physics, you simply can't go wrong here. Graphics are pleasing but simple, so performance is excellent.
My only complaint is that there is nothing to do in free flight mode; having some sort of collectibles scattered around the world would make it much more fun to just fly around exploring.
This game is just great. One of the best games for the Rift!

This was one of the best deals on the touch anniversary sale ($15 USD).  Absolutely a bargain.  It's not the most realistic flight simulation out there, but it is the best flight VR experience out there.  VR just brings an immersion that no other platform can bring to the flight experience.  This game perfectly balances realism with the practicality of the limitations of VR.  And you can choose whether you want an arcade or a simulation experience in any event if you find the simulation just a little bit too difficult.  Althought I do recommend the simulation mode.  There's just a great joy of flying in the air and it's very relaxing. And yes you can kamikaze yourself if you're feeling a little mischevious / nihilistic :D

As soon as i have a friend over who has never expereinced VR before this is the first game i get them to play. Its simple yet so well done. Seeing peoples reactions as they take off into the sky and then look down and around is first class. Yes the graphics might be cartoony and there isnt a whole lot of planes to fly at the minute but this is a fun game. When you turn it to simulation mode aswell it gets a whole lot more challenging for something that might look like a childs game. Would definately reccommend this for anyones library.
I used to fly single engine planes, and this is one of the best simulators I have ever used.

review_title: NOT a wii sports resort island game
one_reviews_text: From the screenshots, reviews etc I had seen this as an equivalent of the wii game where graphics are colourful cartoon like and planes are nice to fly. You have the same challenges of flying through rings, time challenge etc so it is similar in many respects. However, when it describes the game as having 4 islands I pictured large islands to fly around, through tunnels etc. This was not the case. The islands are small and graphics very blocky indeed. No enjoyment to be had. I really wanted to like this game, I really did. So I stuck with it for a good 2 hours making sure I wasnt giving up too soon. I unlocked the second planes, I bought several runaways waiting for things to really get going. Unfortunately it didnt. If I could refund this game I would, but I played it for too long so cannot. Really VERY disappointed in a game I wanted to love.
review_feedback: We're sorry the game didn't meet your expectations.

one_reviews_text: This is my new favorite Oculus title-- probably the best sit-down style game I've played so far. Great way to relax and blow off some steam at the end of the day. Sense of flying is fantastic. Only wish there was some sort of multiplayer mode.
I've been having more fun with this than Aerofly 2 and X-Plane 11!  Using the Touch controllers is very immersive, and the flight model is pretty good too!  Really good fun.

review_title: Best flying Sim. Needs more crafts.
one_reviews_text:
I'm not asking for the world here. Just 1 or 2 more planes. Or a "Multiplayer" mode were people can do ride alongs. or you can enjoy freeflight with other pilots.
Great Sim.
a good flight sim with a real feel for actually flying

Bought this game because I like the idea of flying I can't flip the gas flow swich I have tried several times. So I guess I am groundedI had expected that the graphics would be better also ,to my disappountment they are very very cartoonish
review_feedback: Grab the switch and rotate like a key.  Email us at support@bitplanetgames.com if you need additional help.

one_reviews_text: Purchased this to build VR flight legs before jumping into ACS.  At first I was put-off my the simplistic graphics but once I started flying all buyer remorse vanished.  It's a ton of fun!  So easy to jump in for a quick flight and I love the touch controls, although I wish there was a way to use my Seitek rudder pedals.  It would be very easy to build on this title and I hope that the dev does so.  I have to figure out how to reduce some of the graphical ailiasing but I don't think that's an issue with the title (will research).  Well worth the money.

review_title: So Much Better Than I Expected!
one_reviews_text:
I held off on buying this game, because it seemed small and arcade-y.  I wasn't looking for a flight sim, but the screenshots made this game seem short and small.  This is not the case; I am only 10% into the game, and I already feel that I got my money's worth, with much more to experience.  I do hope that more airplanes are added (even as DLC), but with what is there already, I am satisfied.

Flying is an incredible experience which this game does very well for an early VR game.  The graphics and settings make it a comfortable experience from the very beginning, and things like speed and tight rotations and turns are gradually introduced as you progress through the game.

I highly recommend this game to absolutely everyone who owns an Oculus Rift.

This game is total awesomeness. As of November 2017 its very well polished and controls are spot on. The feel of different aircraft is brilliant. Apart from rudder controls this game was designed for touch controllers and its great to fly it this way. HOTAS controls are not suitable because you have to use your hands on ingame instruments.
If you play this game just to follow mission instructions to complete objectives, and you lack imagination to do anything else you might get bored soon. But if you go nuts and try to skim water surface, loops, landing on hard to get places, racing buildings/mountains "redbull" style and pumping that glider jet engine button 1 meter from the ground you will have wet pants of happiness :]

Since I never flew any actual ultralight plane, I can't tell how close it is in terms of simulation. All I can tell is - it's believably and lots of fun to play! A nobrainer for the price. Only thing that needs to be mentioned - have a stable stomach! It's a flight simulator. So no way to get around motion sickness. It has three comfort modes but I can't tell how good they are. I don't get sick easy.
NIce to take a break and fly around. I use this instead of my meditation app. Worth it if it is on sale.
Great experience, not sure how 'realistic' anyone serious about flight sims would find it, but I found it enjoyable. Shame it has no multiplayer.

Update: save game issue now fixed.

I love a complex flight sim but this is simple fun and very immersive if you fancy yourself as a pilot. One thing i havent seen before is using the touch controller as a yoke which works really well and i could be persuaded to give up my X52 if this were implemented in other sims.
GG all around fun

I bought this game thinking "I liked Pilotwings and if this has a similar vibe we should be good." What I played was a well flushed out gorgeous looking game with fun planes and challenges of various difficulty. It has the relaxed Pilotwings vibe that I wanted too. Shooting balloons with a handgun is immense fun and something I didn't know I wanted badly in a multiplayer game (come on make one devs!). You start off with just an ultra light plane, the first acquired plane I got through doing jobs was the rocket powered glider-- that just blew my mind. However this game could cause motion sickness, if you are prone to that take that into consideration (there are comfort options). After my brain adjusted and started to focus on points in the landscape instead of dead center and the wings cutting through the air, I was fine. Good physics help too, movement matches the expected reality. There are many hours of content, making this a great bargain compared to some other games--- that is if you want to get gold in all the challenges (like me). This is high quality stuff. Can you tell I like the game?

As an amateur pilot and rc pilot I love the physic of this game but it's more of a real simulator with enjoyable missions (I did not try the aracade mode with simple physic). I am having so much fun and the feeling of really flying is really there. The physic is also really working in unusual situations. I know I will have to spend a lot of time inside. The touch controllers are used to their full potential.
Love this game. Everyone should own this.

review_feedback:
Hello!  Once you unlock new mission types revisit previous airports to earn more money doing new missions.

The rocket glider button should be fixed!

review_title: Good game to buy, but not thrilling
one_reviews_text: I really have enjoyed the game so far.  It's fun progressing to better and better airplanes and doing the different types of jobs they offer.  I never thought I'd have to pilot an airplane while firing a handgun before.  It's a good time.  I'd say that $20 is probably a fair price for this game in it's current condition.  Others many not be a fan of the genre and feel less is appropriate, but that's my 2 cents.

review_feedback: Have you unlocked the Sport Plane or the rocket-powered Glider?

review_title: July 20 update appears to wipe savegame
one_reviews_text: The 1.32 update of July 20, although nice because it adds boats and stuff to keep you company in the game world, appears to reset all your progress to 0% (thanks fredholder for the heads-up). Fear not, as your hard-earned in-game money and planes are not lost forever: just copy over the Floppy*.dat files from "...\AppData\LocalLow\Bit Planet Games, LLC\Ultrawings" to "...\AppData\LocalLow\Bit Planet Games LLC\Ultrawings" (notice the missing comma in the new path). Hope that the developers can fix this in a new update!!!
review_feedback: Thanks for the tips @LukeRoss. We are aware of this issue and are working to resolve it as quickly as possible. Please be aware that if you take @LukeRoss's advice you may need to copy the saved games back over.

one_reviews_text: Very reminiscent of PilotWings, lots of fun, worth the price. I hope there's more content coming (even as paid DLC, you make it, I'll buy it!).

I can't believe the negative reviews. This feels very solid and polished. Touch support is great. As someone who is used to hardcore flight sims/hotas set ups, I still enjoy this a hell of a lot. The best thing is the inexplicable feeling of being pushed against your seat when you turn and bank. People who find this 'nauseous' are missing the point. It's exactly how you would feel in a normal aircraft. Also people reporting bugs shouldn't be blaming the game for issues with their set ups. I have encountered NO issues at all.
Well done devs!

The immersion of flying on a ULM is superb. I often fly on these small aircraft in real life and I find the same sensations.

Note: the update of 20.7 broke something:
- save file wiped.
- stability... sometimes crash to desktop, sometimes  lose the viewpoint center (the recalibration with double thumbstick doesn't work)
review_feedback: I believe we have addressed these issues. Please contact us at http://bitplanetgames.com/contact/ if additional support is needed.

one_reviews_text: What a wonderful experience. Despite the cartoonish style you really get the sense that you're flying. Kudos to the developers, this was a polished and novel experience. Being able to use the Touch controllers to interact with the aircraft controls really took the immersion to new heights ;) Looking forward to a sequel.
Very good flight game...

Video of the first hour, no commentaries: https://youtu.be/Mz9Ub6znRA0

The game has a very interesting and simple premise. It's about flight. And the joy of simple flying. A very good medium for introduction to flight to newcomers as well as a very good test of VR features. It is unfortunate, however, that the game displays so few features. Few Game Modes, Few Variation of planes, Few environements. Also some very sought-after features lacking; Weather, Season, Visual Effects. These could all be only cosmetics. But definitely lacking. 
Another Negative (probably the biggest) is the sounds and Music. Very lacking, too simplistic and that cute tune, is the only tune. Very annoying after about 5 minutes.
review_feedback: We do have multiple music tracks but they play based on the island you're currently at!

review_title: Great Game, Could Use a Little Work
one_reviews_text: As a long time fan of flight sims, I was looking forward to this one with great interest.  I find the game charming and the VR menus and interface is well polished.  The touch controls within the cockpit are top notch and feel great.  It's a great entry level flight sim to just enjoy flying.  However, this is the first VR game so far that has made me nauseous.  I have many hours of Aerofly and Elite Dangerous in VR without that feeling. Just something to be aware of, everyone is different.
review_feedback: Hello!  Please send us more information about your rig at support@bitplanetgames.com.  We are not aware of any performance issues with the game.

one_reviews_text: Fun little game, with some development - mainly making it much bigger, having more areas to look at, having more things going on, it could be great. I agree completely with the other person talking about the music - it just endlessly loops, at least so far, I flew to another island and it still just looped over and over again. But still you can turn it off and just play something of your own on your PC if you want, and you'll most likely want to. Anywho it's worth checking out, it's exactly like what you'd expect, a simple flying game in a simple environment which is completely dead, so you're just sightseeing a bit and having the fun of flying around. Like a 3.9 out 5. Also I get motion sick pretty easily and this game will certainly make yo motion sick if you're like me, 10 straight minutes of flying and I was ready to puke. Not much they can do about that, the game runs perfect, just the nature of VR with some people.
review_feedback: You might try setting the controls to arcade. It should help with motion sickness because it will restrict the aircraft's rotation, keeping the horizon mostly horizontal. Many people find this to be helpful.

one_reviews_text: As a big fan of pilotwings64 and also someone who would love to fly, this is a lot of fun.  It really gives the feeling of flight.  I am very happy that I bought this.

review_title: Edited review* Some quirks but good
one_reviews_text:
The game itself is a good experience. I'd go as far as to say it would be a good game for people susceptible to motion sickness as a way to try get your VR legs, as it can trigger motion sickness but the way in which it does this is completly under your control so you can kind of push your limits at your own pace.

Thanks to Chris Stockman for helping me address the issues I was having.
(If you are having issues with the floor height and control levels being off, crouch a bit or stand on your toes depending on if the environment is too high or low and then click both analogue sticks on the touch controllers. The floor position seems to be independent of your Oculus app settings.)
review_feedback:
Hello!  You can you reach us at support@bitplanetgames.com.  

Also, you can message us via our company website www.bitplanetgames.com

one_reviews_text: Great little game, heavy pilotwings vibes. A bit more variety would not go amiss, and more things like baloon shooting in the light aircraft would be cool. Hopefully this gets a sequel :)

This is an average flight game with basic graphics. I was able to play for a while and then an update I installed left the game uninstallable despite numerous attempts. Advise caution in purchasing this title.
review_feedback:
Hi, we're sorry you are experiencing technical difficulties.  Can you please email us at support@bitplanetgames.com with a description of the issue you're having?

Thank you.

one_reviews_text: Great

This game is exactly what it says it is. If you're too focused on certain elements of the graphical presentation of the game, you can easily miss the fun and quality. 

This game is fun because it not only has a semi-realistic flight experience that's simple to work with, but also provides satisfying challenges as well. Exploration is key to getting new aircraft and unlocking new challenges.

Impatience will not work.

I was a huge fan of pilot wings on SNES and N64 and was hoping for a VR version of that, but this has none of the polish or little touches that made those special.  I played for about 20 minutes before uninstalling
review_feedback: Stay tuned!  We're testing a major update to the game now that adds a level of polish to the world that we weren't able to include before launch.

one_reviews_text:
It's fun in a way that no flight sim has been in a long time. It feels natural to sit in the pilot's seat, grab the flight stick, flip switches, and push buttons. The flight model is a perfect combination of arcade and just enough realism to make it challenging.

The gameplay is straightforward. It tests your skill by giving you progressively harder challenges that you need to complete to move on to a better airport, a better, plane, etc.

I didn't expect that non-realistic ground scenery would work this well. All in all, this is a much better experience than the leading VR flight sims. Kudos to the development team. Two thumbs up (and you can do that in the game, too!).

review_title: The best game for the rift so far!
one_reviews_text: I have spent hundreds of dollars on games that I don't play. This game has me hooked! It brings back memories of pilot wings 64. I only have a couple hours of flight time in the game and I can't wait to play more. Using the touch controllers to interact with the aircraft controls is perfect! I really really hope they have more in the works for this wonderful game! kudos to the developers for creating such a masterpiece!

review_title: Nice flight experience with Oculus touch
one_reviews_text: ...a nice and simple flight simulator with good physics! Especially with the oculus touch quite immersive. Landscape could be more realistic and bigger maps would be appreciated. Well, a nice game for everyone who wants an easy "flight simulator" for leisure flying in VR...

review_title: The Flight Sim I've Been Waiting For
one_reviews_text: Absolutely amazing! Very smooth. Outstanding fun! Finally a sim that lets me hold the stick and operate the controls by hand. Hope this becomes multiplayer.

I'm a flight simmer who remembers Pilotwings of old.  Nowadays I prefer DCS or something of the like, so I went into this knowing it wasnt a sim. However, in "sim" mode, I found the flight model for the ultralight not terribly unrealistic.  I couldnt quite put it into a spin but then again I havent gotten to the other aircraft yet. It needs rudder support. I'm not sure full HOTAS support is necessary.  The neat thing about this game is that it shows you can create a fairly immersive flight experience with just the touch controllers. But rudder control is necessary. The use of the thumbstick for rudder works fairly well but it is no substitute for the real thing.

I've put a good few hours into this, and on the whole it's really enjoyable. The flight model is nice (convincing without being too simmy), the sound is great, the control scheme is mostly good, and there's a few really good game modes. 
There's two modes which are basically standard checkpoint races, which are fine. There's a mode where you have to land in tricky spots, which is fun. Photo mode (find a particular landmark and take a picture from the correct angle) should be great, but it's ridiculously fussy and doesn't give you much help if you don't quite get the shot right. 
The best thing is balloon mode, where you have a gun in one hand to shoot balloons as you fly past. Brilliant fun in the micro-light, but as far as I can tell it's impossible with the glider as you don't get a gun (that I can find), and popping them with the plane doesn't count. I'm sure I'm missing something, but it's not at all clear what.
The difficulty level is a bit all over the place. Some missions are trivial, while some are frustratingly difficult.
The unlock structure also feels a bit steep. I get that they need to spread the content out, but unlocking the 5th landing strip costs a fortune.

None of those niggles spoils it though - it's a lot of fun to fly about. Could easily be 5* with some tweaks and balancing.

This game would have sold me to the Oculus if I wasn't already interested in buying it in the first place. This is what VR is all about. 100% immersion into a game. I can sit (read -sit-) here for hours and enjoy flying or soaring around. 

However, on that note, the game does need to be bigger. For example, more areas to fly around, and more aircraft. I would love to see FSX type simulator for the touch. But for this game, 5 stars!
You may thing its just OK when flying the first plane, the ultralight. Yeah...just wait until you have a jet powered glider. Game gets intense very quickly, flight model is perfect.

High production value. Great controls and fun gameplay. But beware if you are prone to motion sickness. The game has various comfort settings (more closed cockpit), but even so it can make you queezy, if you don't have your VR legs. Aside from that. Wonderful.

review_title: Great fun and plenty of gameplay for $
one_reviews_text: Easy to pick up, adictive and enough content and variation to make you keep coming back. Finally another game with multiple saves (4), I can't tell u how frustrating it is to try to demo games to visitors and have to reset your single save so the newbie can start from the beginning (SuperHotVR anyone?), more of this pls other devs. Have not had any of the tracking/control issues others have mentioned. Your hand can come off the stick fairly easily (cos it's a VR stick, u can't feel it) but after a while you realise what's happened, look down and re-grab the stick. There are some issues in the menus/laptop and very rarely the game doesn't seem to log the end result despite the in-cockpit display showing I should have got a medal. There are some real 'yeh-ha!' moments to be had and many missions come across almost like puzzles where you really have to think about your route, when u use ur rocket etc. The rocket glider is awesome fun to fly and the 'simple' graphics work really well. Great game!

Flight controls can intermittently freeze. The game shows the stick and foot pedals moving, but the flight model won't respond for 3-5 seconds. Often, it responds jerkily while in normal flight as well. Makes it frustrating to "fly". The game Eagle Flight shows that a smooth and responsive flight model is doable.
review_feedback: This bug was related to Arcade Controls. It has been fixed in an update and works much much better now, dare a say 'solved.' Have a go and tell us what you think. If you agree how about bumping up that star rating sir. We care about our reviews and every star counts! Hope you agree, UW Dev Team

review_title: Proves touch can work for flight sim
one_reviews_text: I'm a hardcore DCS simmer, but I can appreciate Ultrawings for what it is: a light, recreational sim that's good, simple fun. Haven't experienced any technical issues or crashes (other than the pilot induced kind). Kudos for being the first flight sim with touch support. Here's hoping for many more.

review_title: Finally a touch enabled flight sim
one_reviews_text: I've been asking for this as soon as I saw Touch revealed and it's finally here after many months of me pestering the developers on their Facebook page.  Graphics are simple but look good in VR.  Controls are very well done and planes control very nicely.  I definitely want to see more planes added and some new maps.  I'd also love some multiplayer that makes use of the rift mic and filters the voice to make it sound like it's coming through the flight comms.

This game/flight sim is really good fun.  The graphics are very nice and even though not photo realistic there is so much imersion from them. The controls are really easy to use and well done.  Picking jobs using a laptop is great and to transition from the hanger to the cockpit by putting your helmet on is brilliant.  I hope extra islands, airports, missions and ofcourse aircraft are added.
AWFULL REALISM

Many hours of gaming which isn't apparent at first. Several different planes to unlock, each with different mechanics, as well as additional airports. I had a blast trying to gold star each challenge. After playing for a better part of a day I'm only 25% complete. Well worth the money!
Really fun and the controls are well executed. This is not a complete simultator, but have a nice arcade feel to it that give it charm. Recommended.

So far the game has crashed twice during training and induced a lot of nausea. It's not clear yet how much content there is in the game. I will explore the game more and update this with a higher rating if I discover more content (assuming I can adjust to the nausea). (Pro tip: to turn off the music look to your left and turn the dial on the radio... I like the control scheme!) UPDATE: Dropping my review score because now, after coming back to the game a few hours later, the game is constantly crashing when I try to go into the course job.

review_title: Needs more content, but really fun as is
one_reviews_text:
I really like this game. The feeling of making a big banking turn is much like that of being in a real airplane. (I get kinda woosy if we do circles) 

It does need more content though, and I would really love to see a multiplayer aspect be added. There are 3 planes so far and it would be great if we could dogfight each other. One of my favorite games of my childhood was Red Baron on the Imagination Network. It was simple dogfighting, but it was a blast and a game like this could really benefit from something like that. I'm sure there's more to come, and I can't wait to play it. 

Worth the money in my opinion.

review_title: A fun VR flightsim set back by bugs
one_reviews_text: I had quite a bit of fun playing this when everything worked smoothly. I like the style and design even though it's not what would really be good for a serious flight sim, which this really isn't. I do wish it had a bit larger of a plane choice however. That being said, for all the fun that it is, it's set back by bugs at almost every step of the way that either kill the game or force me to restart. The two biggest ones that I've had so far is the failure to load the mission if I hit the laptop as I'm putting the helmet on, and the sudden loss of the ability to grip in game objects with a Touch controller. Minus those, the game would be great for what it is, a fun and casual flight game.

This is another VR game that put a grin on my face while I was playing it (and a cringe when I crashed). Very enjoyable to fly around and just enough of a challenge to make me want to get better. I have not experienced any crashes or control issues like some of the other reviews on here.

This would be a great way to introduce friends and family to "VR". I have a HOTAS and this game doesn't support it- that is completely fine because the devs handled it well. The game plays wonderfully on a min spec PC and the Design really is engaging. If you like casual experiences that get you away for a bit- buy this.
Great simple but immersive flying game. Really feels like you have your own little plane. Graphics are simple but nice.
I had some issues with controls freezing when I first made the purchase, but now everything is running great for me!  Tons of fun here!
I've been playing this ganme since launch and its been fun.  The graphics arn't anything to write home about, but the joy is real.
Get RID of the stupid helmet - period. I spent the last 5 minutes JUST TRYING TO PICK IT UP. The interface is buggy, sticky, frustrating and absurd. Uninstalled...
review_feedback: We changed the interaction of the Helmet a bit. Let us know if this helped. Also, be sure that you are not pointing at the helmet when you try and pick it up or you will push it instead. If you like the fix how about upping your rating. Every review counts! Thanks, Ultrawings Dev Team

one_reviews_text:
I am enjoying this more than i thoght i would. Sure it is pricey for its content, but what VR game isn`t?
First game to show that in-game touch flight controls work quite well.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BlRusKT_s-o
My Thoughts: I really enjoyed this game. It has a great sense of flying... see my video above to see what I really thought of this game!
while the graphics are on the low side the actual game play and imerssion is great I have not yet tried it with the Touvh but just the controller is great really enjoyed the game
If you liked Pilot Wings, you'll like this. I've been having a blast with it.

review_title: One of the best VR I've played
one_reviews_text: As a pilot, this is a great game. The controls are excellent and the manuverability is awesome. If you like flight games, this one is a must!

review_title: So realistic I got clogged ears
one_reviews_text: I used to flight real small aircrafts and this game is so realistic I got clogged ears.
Nice game
